main event: A white, oval-shaped object the size of a golf ball was reported circling over Hanover and McSherrystown, Pennsylvania in 1965.
interesting points: The object was observed for 20 minutes and did not change position.
The object was observed from two vantage points by two witnesses, including a radio announcer who was considered a reliable witness.
The object was reported to have rapid forward accelerations and decelerations, hovering at treetop level.
Weather data was provided, including cloud cover, wind speed, and temperature.
No reasonable explanation was given for the sighting based on the information received.
sighted object: a white, oval-shaped object the size of a golf ball
witnesses: two witnesses, including a radio announcer
